Centered on the hoist-side red band in yellow is the national emblem (the [[Soyombo symbol]]). |Type = National }} The '''Flag of [[Mongolia]]''' ({{lang-mn|Монгол улсын төрийн далбаа}}, '''State flag of Mongolia''') consists of three equal bands, of alternating red, blue and red, with the [[Soyombo symbol|soyombo]] national symbol<ref>[[Montsame News Agency]]. ''Mongolia''. 2006, ISBN 99929-0-627-8, p. 8</ref> centering the first red band in yellow. The central blue band is described as the [[Tengri|eternal blue sky]], while the side red bands represent the ability of Mongolia to thrive in its harsh environment. The soyombo is a columnar arrangement of abstract and geometric representations of fire, sun, moon, earth, water, and the [[Taijitu]] or [[Yin-Yang]] symbol. The current flag was adopted on February 12, 1992, after the [[1990 Democratic Revolution in Mongolia|transition of Mongolia to a democracy]]. It is similar to the flag of 1949, except for the removal of the [[Red star#Symbol of communism|socialist star]] on top of the Soyombo. ==Historical flags== ===Flag of 1911=== :"Many countries of the World have a flag.
